intro: Systeloglossum costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Systeloglossum costaricense thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane regions with high humidity.
